intro: Iris winkleri, commonly known as the Winkler iris, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in well-drained, moist soils. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
